Description: Rim sherd of East Greek pottery rosette or lotus bowl; interior glazed black (over-fired to red); exterior: black band at top of plain rim; wide reserved band below with groups of narrow vertical strokes; below, black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes 1992, 207, N20: "Probably North Ionian ware cf. Price (1924) 186, fig 9. Counterpart of the ("Rhodian") bowl seriesTocra I no. 733ff pl.8 and G. Ploug Sukas II (Kobenhavn 1973) 42-43 nos. 142-47 pl. VII.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 207 no. N20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.278)
